text:
Clamp the maternal end of the umbilical cord close to the perineum with a pair of artery 
forceps.
/circle6 Hold the clamped end of the cord with one hand.
/circle6 Place the other hand on the motherâ€™s abdomen to feel the uterine contraction.
/circle6 Maintain slight tension on the cord.
Antenatal Care and Skilled Attendance at Birth by ANMs/LHVs/SNsGUIDELINES
50
/circle6 When the uterus contracts,  as will be evidenced by the uterus becoming hard and 
globular, gently pull downwards on the cord
